fields.Title of Presentation: A New Venue for Community Collaboration: The IYR/Boise State OPWL Strategic Partnership
fields.Description/Abstract:
Over the last year, the Director of Training & Career Development at the Idaho Youth Ranch has partnered with an Associate Professor in Boise State’s Organizational Performance and Workplace Learning program. Volunteering their time and working virtually, graduates and students of BSU’s OPWL online master’s program have created training and job support materials for IYR staff and volunteers. A $21K+ in-kind contribution, these materials range from skill-based training for their Programs staff to simple “cheat sheets” that help people to execute specific tasks with little or no training at all.

The presenters will describe:
• The work this partnership has created to date.
• How they qualified this partnership in ways that would benefit all participants.
• How the partnership currently works.
• Benefits the partnership has produced.
• Lessons they have learned, including tips on creating a mutually beneficial relationship between two (or more parties) who have different attainable goals.
